Repondia allows top-tier hospitality groups to significantly improve guest experience and booking requests with a smart WhatsApp assistant.

For each missed call detected, Repondia connects with the client via WhatsApp to collect booking details, answer questions, and notify teams.

To this day, by being equipped in dozens of venues across Europe, Repondia has managed to save more than a thousand booking requests, representing hundreds of thousands of euros, while helping restaurant crews handle a huge number of missed calls easily.

Repondia has been a success everywhere it has been installed!

Feel free to reach out for any info!

Karelytics LLC is an AI-driven platform that revolutionizes health insurance risk management by integrating actuarial science, predictive analytics, and machine learning to provide real-time risk assessment, pricing optimization, and fraud detection. The platform offers three core modules: smart risk assessment for accurate premium pricing, coverage optimization for personalized insurance plans, and AI-powered fraud detection with blockchain technology for secure claims processing. The platform aims to support health insurance companies, healthcare providers, and policymakers through enhanced financial sustainability, improved policy decisions, and risk optimization, ultimately making health insurance more affordable for consumers.

SanLucar is a global company that is dedicated to bringing people natural joy of life and health in a way it can be proud of. Offering a variety of more than 100 delicious fruits and vegetables from more than 35 countries, SanLucar is the brand with the broadest top-quality assortment in the German, Austrian and Dutch retail market. The portfolio also includes smoothies, fresh cut, as well as flowers and plants and now also ice cream. Currently, SanLucar is expanding into Canada, Italy, England, Scandinavia, Poland, Ecuador, the Middle East and North Africa. 

SanLucar, founded in 1993 by Stephan RÃ¶tzer, is headquartered in Valencia (Spain) with nearly 5,000 employees in Germany, Austria, Benelux, Italy, Spain, Ecuador, Dubai, South Africa, Morocco and Tunisia, both in its office branches and on its own farms. 

The secret of the companyâ€™s success lies not only in combining the traditional wisdom of its master growers with innovation and passion for healthy food, but also in building long-term relationships.

Thereby, the company has the entire value chain in mind: from the selection of varieties to support at the point of sale.

The philosophy "Taste in harmony with people and nature" is the foundation for all actions SanLucar undertakes.

With its corporate responsibility program, DREAMS, SanLucar focuses on its employees and local needs of the communities surrounding its sites.  The focus is on promoting education, nutrition, sports, and environmental protection through plastic reduction and resource-conserving cultivation.

As an active member of the Spanish Global Compact network since 2018, SanLucar is strongly committed to achieving United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs).

column4: Quentin LOEUILLET
column5:
SUMOT develops a technical solution for all designers of electric motorisation systems seeking to make their motors more efficient, economical and sober, whether for e-mobility applications (from e-bikes to electric vehicles and trucks) or industrial applications.

Massive electrification of our means of transport and industrial processes also raises major challenges in terms of energy efficiency, economic cost and environmental impact. Developing electric motors that are more efficient with higher power density, lighter and consuming less materials has become a key technological lock.

ğŸ‘‰â€Š SUMOT is up to the challenge! Our solution: the SUMOT overfluxer ğŸš€
 
Our power electronics device is connected between the motor and its power supply system and enables the motor to be boosted when it needs to be, without placing additional constraints on the rest of the system.

ğŸ“ˆ Until +70% output power and +50-60% power density obtained on the Tesla Model S induction motor (simulations)
ğŸ“ˆ Until +65% output power (experiments) and /2 of magnets volume (simulations) obtained on an industrial permanent magnet synchronous motor.

This â€œboostâ€ effect makes it possible to :
ğŸš€ increase power density by increasing the power produced by the motor within the same volume. Over and above the â€œboostâ€ effect, this also enables to use smaller (and lighter) motors or motor topologies with less (or no) magnets, while guaranteeing the same peak output performances.
ğŸ”‹ improve the system efficiency by making motor downsizing more accessible, while guaranteeing the same peak performances, leading to less energy consumption over the operating cycle with a smaller motor more optimised for the most frequently reached operating points;
ğŸ’² reduce the cost by using downsized motors or reducing the amount of critical materials used (magnets);
ğŸŒ reduce the environmental impact by consuming less materials and especially rare earth for magnets

To find out more ğŸ‘‰ robin.thomas@sumot.tech
